Summary: This hotel is STELLAR. I would recommend it over all others in this price range and area!   The facilities are clean, they offer all the important amenities, the location is excellent--and most importantly, the staff and managers are helpful, thoughtful, responsive and patient!   I had to contact this hotel 3 times (for various reasons--documentation, receipts, etc), and each time they responded in less than 24 hrs and helped me with even my more complex issues!   Any hotel can offer amenities and a fair price--but its the customer service that sets an establishment apart.  What is more important than receiving help when you need it???  Few places I have stayed in years of travel have been so courteous and responsive!   I HIGHLY recommend this hotel because their customer

Don’t believe the pictures you see on the internet, this place looks and smells like a dump. The first indication I shouldn’t have even stayed there was the sign that said, “No refunds, no exceptions.” Walked in to a room that had beer cans on the floor, pillows with things on them, dirty and smelly sheets. Carpet felt like mush. DONT TAKE YOUR SHOES OFF. The toilet ran all night. Tried to call the front desk and tell them it ran and was so loud but nobody answered. Finally packed up and left at like 3am. Told the guy at the front desk as I was leaving about the loud toilet and that I couldn’t sleep and he offered no apology. Slept in my car in a hospital parking lot, and had much better of a sleep. Gross. Avoid this place.

Summary Heading: Affordable but is it worth it?
Summary: This place was near a lot of stuff we needed to do so we booked it but rhis place needs to be updated for sure rooms were pretty dirty .breakfast that was offered was very basic 2 cereals and some plain doughnuts .walls are very thin as well .my advice is to book somewhere else or if they update maybe ir would be worth it

Great location, rooms are clean, adaquate free parking, and friendly staff. However, no elevators, rooms need renovation and upgrades. Sinks and bathtubs cannot be filled (plugs don't work..staff said they don't want overflows). Some rooms don't have extra outlets for charging personal devices. Rooms are very dark. Free breakfast consists of cold coffee, pre-packaged Danish, bananas, and muffins, microwave is very dirty. Overall, you get what you pay for.

We staied 4 nights in this little and cheap hotel visiting NAMM. People there were very polite and helpfull(especially that young girl that helped us with the taxi application).Room was clean,big enough with 2 kingsize beds and bothroom comfortable! Although there was no breakfast in booking they still had some coffe and a snak for us in the morning! I'm gonna stay agai there!

So first it needs to point out that I only needed a bed to sleep at night. So if you are looking for a fancy five star experience, this is not the place for you. That being said, I am very satisfied with my experience staying there. There are very few places not to like about the hotel. It's very affordable compared to those next Disneyland. Then the room is very well kept. I dare say it's much cleaner than my room at home. The AC is quiet and powerful. The temperature is perfect. The matress is very comfortable, soft and firm. It gave me a good night's sleep. No bug problem at all. I know some place can be very nasty, but not here. The bathroom is as simple as it should be. The water is powerful and warm. Staff is also helpful with all kinds of stuff. The only few complaints

Arrived late, I had call ahead to notifythat we would be late. They no problem. I requested first floor rooms they said we would have both of our rooms on the first floor. When we got there she said only one was available. The carpet on the first floor was dingy and syained, the stair to the second had accumulated dust and dirt covering the corners. The downstairs room was disgusting, nail clippings on the floor, stale cigarette smell. The breakfast was a roll. The coffee pot was covered with a thick layer of dust. Bad place. Stay away.

I needed a room for a couple of hours to prep for an event.  I called the night before and was told that I could check in any time. What wasn't said was that I could check in IF there was a room available.  When I showed up at 10am I was told that no one had checked out yet. Fortunately, someone came to check out while I was at the front desk.  The room was clean and available in about 30- minutes. Room was clean and had everything one would expect in a hotel in this price range.  There is no air conditioning so the room was a little warm. Room 101 faces a busy street so I didn't open the window.  There was a church service going on a the pool when I first arrived by they finished around 11am. They do rent rooms by the month but the people who seemed to live there at least part

I definitely recommend it if you're on a budget, because after all we are all price conscious when it comes to staying at places.   So what I like about The Grand Inn; -Cost effective- Was nice to my wallet -Bathroom was updated -Bed was comfortable -Conveniently located across the street are Starbucks, Chase Bank, a couple of restaurant places, and 7 Eleven a half block away -3.7 miles 9 minute drive to Disneyland -Free parking with parking in the front and back -Fridge in the room and microwave in the common lounge -LCD tv -Seems like the room was recently updated -Easy check in and out  Have a nice day everyone.

Summary Heading: Great stay for Business trips - screw those bad reviews!
Summary: I was actually debated to check in here in the first place, but I'm super happy that I DID! I believed they has renovated or upgrade the place very well.  The location was super nice! The front desk was super helpful to help out with directions. And the room was actually really homey like. Even though there is a Starbucks right across the street, but the hotel actually also provide free coffee and pastries in the morning.   I realized the location is super close to Disneyland, which can also be a great spot for family vacation, especially with their reasonable price! It was actually really nice to get to see some fireworks at night as well.  I guess can't always rely on people's reviews, especially if its out of date! And I'm super happy that it turnout to be very comfortable
Room tip: Let the front desk know what kind of Room you want!

Summary: I use my credit card once during our road trip, that is to pay for room in this motel. It ended up some one use my credit card to purchase something in Rite Aid. Apart from that, this is a very run down motel, carpet was dingy and sticky, we wore shoe all the time in the room. Bathroom door was unable to close properly, min fridge not working and the whole room is just too dark. Stay away from this motel, pay a little more for better room.

I was lucky to be able to snag a room at this hotel so last minute (about a week before arrival) and for way under my estimated budget (I wanted to pay no more than $200 total). I'm not a hotel stickler, and honestly didn't have too many expectations about the Grand Inn. No frills, and just a place to stay as we were visiting the House of Mouse all week. Check-in was fast and easy, thank you to the front desk staff! I was also offered a bottle of cold water, so nice of her! I did reserve a non-smoking room, however, the room smelled like a little bit like someone had still smoked in there. It didn't really bother us though. The room was pretty basic, but spacious and comfortable enough for us. There is free wifi, and you can get the wifi password at the front desk. In our room,

My stay at the Grand Inn was great. I had no problem finding a room without a reservation during the holidays.There is plenty of parking space, it seems that they recently furnished the room, free WiFi, friendly costumer service, it's location is close to Knott's and Disneyland.    I had nothing to complain about during the few days we stayed, during the last day my boyfriend and I overslept until noon, nobody bothered us to check out at 11:00 a.m. and they did not charge us any extra money!  We will be there for our next vacation time.

Summary Heading: Place like from the movies of Robert Rodriguez
Summary: Want to wish the Grand Inn staff all the best. They manage to make a nice place out of the facilities from the horror movies. I was a bit scared when I walked in into the hallway and even more terrified when I saw the room. However it turned to be well kept, clean and quite place to stay. But still, the some people who stay in this hotel, especially those who live there permanently can scare pants off you,

Summary Heading: Rest your head, go to bed get up and drive on!
Summary: Not bad.. the price was well with in my budget, rooms are clean, does need remodeled, but I felt safe. Check in was quick and they spoke English!!! I was only here for a very short time, I had a long trip back to Wyoming. (spur of the moment road trip) Would I stay here again? Sure. Its convenient and appropriately priced.

Summary Heading: Freezing cold room, dingy decor, loud truck traffic.
Summary: My wife and I booked this hotel for a cheap stay at Disneyland. As long as a room is clean, the bed is comfy, there's decent free WiFi, and the shower is hot we're usually content. The man who checked us in gave us the impression we were interrupting a lousy day and he wanted to get back to sulking.   We got up to our room (#201), which smelled rather unpleasant and was very cold, I'd estimate below 60 fahrenheit. We opened the window to let some warm, less smelly air in. We went to the front desk and explained that we needed heat, and the clerk said that he'd turn on the heat from the central system. We left for Disneyland and returned around 10:30pm to a room that was colder than we left it. (Outdoor temperature was in the low 40s.) We returned to the front desk and asked

Great experience. Front desk is very nice and helpful. Room is clean. Good location, very close to Disneyland. I had a great time there. Everybody is so nice there. Wonderful experience guaranteed.I would recommend that to anybody.

The price was right....$100 - 2 nights.  Should have known that you get what you pay for.  The room was clean, but the repair work that had been done was really shoddy.  The sink had cuts in it and needed to be replaced.  The room did have fairly new carpet.  No screen on the first floor window and the window opened about 4" before the lock engaged.  The towels were very old and barely dried.  The water was hot.  The walls were really thin.  We could actually hear entire conversations being held above us and in the hallway.  There was a gap in the door - you could actually see light from the hallway.  Had to leave a $5. cash deposit for the room key and remote control...this was a first.

I recently stayed here for a family Disneyland trip. This place is small, but pretty nice. The staff there was also very kind. We didn't know the area so well,so the lady there went out of her way to help us out with directions, suggestions etc. Me and my kids had a great time.
The room is clean and quiet.so close disneyland,We are happy on this trip. super recommand.

No heat or A/C, or alarm clocks.  Cigarette smoke all the time from the monthly renters.  Cigarette burns in comforters and nightstands.  Road noise all night long.  They rent rooms by the hour so that will tell you what kind of place this is.  No breakfast or heated pool as advertised.  There is no value and this place should come down.  The Not So Grand Inn.

I have stayed at the Grand Inn numerous times. The staff is very friendly and they made my stay comfortable. Conveniently located, so close we could see the FIREWORKS from Disneyland. (My kids loved watching fireworks from their window every night!!) This place is a steal compared to other Inns in the area. Take my word; I would DEFINETLY stay there again. I highly recommend the Grand Inn.  Luke 6:37    "Do not judge, and you will not be judged. Do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here under any circumstances
Summary: Take my word for it if you trust my reviews. To go into detail would be stepping way outside the bounds of good taste...
